PERSONA:
carlos eduardo hernandez is a 57-year-old divorced man living in the metropolitan area of miami, florida. born in bogotá, colombia, carlos moved to the united states 8 years ago, initially settling in new york city before relocating to miami 3 years ago for work. he is a naturalized u.s. citizen, having gained citizenship 4 years ago.

carlos holds a degree in finance from universidad de los andes in bogotá and later pursued a master's in business administration (mba) at florida international university. he currently works as a financial analyst for a mid-sized import-export firm in miami's international trade district, specializing in trade agreements between the u.s. and latin america.

despite his education and professional experience, carlos' income of $37,500 per year reflects the challenges he faced after relocating to the u.s. and navigating the job market as an immigrant. his previous job experience in colombia and his business knowledge have been valuable assets, but the salary is lower than he anticipated.

carlos owns a modest two-bedroom condominium in a mixed neighborhood in the western part of miami, which he purchased with the assistance of a federal housing administration (fha) loan. his monthly mortgage payment is approximately $1,800, including property taxes and insurance. carlos manages his expenses carefully to accommodate his modest income, supporting himself and occasionally sending money back to his family in colombia.

carlos is a practicing roman catholic, attending mass occasionally, and identifies as a born-again christian. although he never attends religious services, his faith remains a personal aspect of his life.

politically, carlos aligns himself as an independent but leans towards the democratic party, citing concerns about economic inequality, access to healthcare, and immigration reform. he supports pro-immigrant policies, given his personal experiences, and advocates for expanded health insurance coverage. carlos values his right to vote, ensuring his registration is always up to date.

carlos' economic concerns revolve around job security, affordable healthcare, and maintaining a decent standard of living amidst rising costs of living in miami. he hopes the government will address these issues and capitalize on miami's growing position in international trade, providing better opportunities for residents.

in his free time, carlos enjoys reading about history, watching soccer, and listening to salsa music. he does not volunteer due to time constraints but hopes to engage more in community activities once his finances become more stable.

carlos frequently uses the internet for work, staying updated on current events and news. his political opinions are shaped by his experiences as an immigrant, his faith, and his desire for socio-economic stability and equality.
